citation.article-title: Pseudoclavibacter soli sp. nov., a β-glucosidase-producing bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudoclavibacter soli sp. nov.
Pseudoclavibacter soli (so′li. L. neut. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the organism).
Gram-positive, aerobic, non-motile, rod-shaped (about 0.3–0.5 μm long and 0.2–0.3 μm wide) after growth on R2A agar at 30 °C for 5 days.
Colonies grown on R2A agar for 4 days are pale-yellow in colour and circular.
Growth occurs at 25–42 °C and pH 5–8; optimum temperature and pH for growth are 30 °C and pH 7.

Produces acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase (C8), leucine arylamidase, lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and valine arylamidase, but not N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase, protease (gelatin hydrolysis), trypsin and urease.

Acetate, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, citrate, lactate, propionate and n-valerate are assimiliated, but not adipate, l-alanine, l-arabinose, caprate, l-fucose, gluconate, d-glucose, glycogen, l-histidine, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, myo-inositol, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, d-malate, malonate, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, phenyl acetate, l-proline, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, l-serine, d-sorbitol, suberate or sucrose.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.4 mol%.
Predominant menaquinones are MK-9 and MK-8.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, iso C16 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The type strain, KP02T (=KCTC 19255T=JCM 15058T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Daejeon, South Korea.
